oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Special Order No. 238 issued by Gen. Ulysses S. Grant appointing a sergeant in Louisiana Volunteers of African Descent
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Orders issued by Gen. Ulysses S. Grant appointing Sgt. Zina B. Chatfield of Co. A, 4th Regt., Minn. Inf. Vols., USA, Orderly Sgt., in the 12th Regt. of Louisiana Volunteers of African Descent. Signed by John Aaron Rawlins, Assistant Adjutant General. Chatfield enlisted in Co. A, 4th Minn. Inf. Regt. on September 27, 1861. He was commissioned an officer in Co. F., U. S. Colored Troops, 58th Inf. Regt., on September 29, 1863. He was mustered out on April 30, 1866.
